sentences: Elissar Zakaria Khoury (Arabic: إليسار زكريا خوري; born 27 October 1972), commonly known as Elissa (Arabic: إليسا), is a Lebanese recording artist.
section: N/A

sentences: She is one of Lebanon's most famous singers, and one of the best-known artists in the Arab world.
section: N/A

sentences: She has been among the highest-selling female Middle Eastern artists since 2005.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2005, she became the first Lebanese singer to receive the World Music Award for Best Selling Middle Eastern Artist, an award that she received again in 2006 and 2010.
section: N/A

sentences: She has currently sold over 30 million albums worldwide.
section: N/A

sentences: Elissa is also one of the richest celebrities in Lebanon, with a reported estimated wealth of over $40 million.
section: N/A

sentences: As of 2019, Elissa has over 50 million followers on social media.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2018, Elissa appeared as a judge on The Voice: Ahla Sawt, the Arab edition of The Voice.
section: N/A
== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Elissa was born in Deir Al-Ahmar to a Lebanese father and a Syrian mother from Wadi al-Nasara.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She has three brothers Ghassan, Kamil and Jihad and two sisters Norma and Rita.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Elissa was raised in the Beqaa Valley with her other siblings.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She graduated from the Lebanese University with a degree in political science.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Although she had a degree in politics, she was additionally interested in making music.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Therefore, after graduating, she decided to pursue a professional career in show business and in music.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: To successfully combine her passion of politics and theatre, Elissa joined Le Théâtre de Dix-Heures, a Lebanese Theatrical Group.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: On the album's titular single, she collaborated with Spanish singer, Gerard Ferrer.

== Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Personal life and political views ==
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: In 2014, Elissa took to social media to condemn the atrocities committed by ISIS against minorities, stating "I'm Lebanese and I'm proudly Christian, shame on such people."
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Elissa is an outspoken advocate of women's rights in the Middle East.
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: An advocate for breast cancer awareness, Elissa revealed her previously private diagnosis and defeat of an early stage of the disease with the release of her music video for "Ila Kol Elli Bihebbouni"; previously keeping it a secret from both the press and general public from her diagnosis in late 2017.
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: The video ends with the following message: "I've recovered, I've beaten the illness and I won...
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Early detection of breast cancer can save your life...
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Don't ignore it, face it...
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Do it not only for yourself, but for your loved ones."
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Many applauded her for "breaking the taboo" of breast cancer awareness in the Middle East and therefore influenced and encouraged women to be checked for the disease.
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: The hashtags #Elissa (اليسا#) and #To_All_Who_Love_Me (الى_كل_اللي_بيحبوني#) began to trend in Lebanon and surrounding countries in the Middle East.
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: In October 2018, Elissa was chosen as an ambassador for a breast cancer awareness campaign in Beirut.
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: Elissa admitted in May Chidiac Foundation conference that she was subject of bullying for her mouth on social media, but she said, "When you achieve what I achieved in life, you can come and say whatever you want.
section: == Personal life and political views ==

sentences: "She is a supporter of the Lebanese Forces party and its leader Samir Geagea, backing him for the presidency before the election of Michel Aoun.
section: == Personal life and political views ==
